meanings.definition: Expressing oneself clearly and effectively in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: She gave an articulative presentation that everyone understood.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's articulative explanation helped the students grasp the concept easily.
meanings.sent3: His articulative storytelling kept the audience engaged and entertained.
meanings.sent4: The articulative power of her words painted a vivid picture in the listener's mind.
meanings.sent5: The articulative nature of his writing made it a pleasure to read.

meanings.definition: Capable of forming distinct sounds or words.
meanings.sent1: The articulative pronunciation of the new student was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The singer's articulative voice made every lyric crystal clear.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's articulative mimicry of human speech amused everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The articulative nature of the wind through the trees sounded like a whispered secret.
meanings.sent5: The articulative enunciation of the actor captivated the audience.
